result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. TIMOTHY P. REITER

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
2:12 PM Defendant TIMOTHY P. REITER in court, in custody.  Attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions DE re: right to attorney and prelim rights.  DE unsure.  Court reviews attorney rights and right to have attorney present at prelim.  DE waives time limits to allow him to have attorney present.  Court accepts waiver of time limits.  DA Parker - State was prepared to proceed with prelim today.  DE wants to hire private counsel.
Status conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
